title: Teku still defaults to the Altona network configuration
body:
Version: `teku/v0.12.6-dev-53fa964e/linux-x86_64/-ubuntu-openjdk64bitservervm-java-11`

```
> ./build/install/teku/bin/teku
2020-09-02 17:24:20,348 main INFO Configuring logging for destination: console and file
2020-09-02 17:24:20,350 main INFO Logging file location: /home/ben/.local/share/teku/logs/teku.log
2020-09-02 17:24:20,350 main INFO Logging includes events: true
2020-09-02 17:24:20,351 main INFO Logging includes validator duties: true
2020-09-02 17:24:20,351 main INFO Logging includes color: true
17:24:20.418 INFO  - Teku version: teku/v0.12.6-dev-53fa964e/linux-x86_64/-ubuntu-openjdk64bitservervm-java-11
17:24:20.557 INFO  - Loading 0 validator keys...
17:24:20.559 INFO  - Loaded 0 Validators: 
17:24:20.594 INFO  - Using data path: /home/ben/.local/share/teku/data
17:24:20.797 INFO  - Initializing storage
17:24:20.806 INFO  - Storage initialization complete
17:24:20.864 INFO  - Loading genesis from jar:file:/home/ben/Everything/ConsenSys/Teku/build/install/teku/lib/teku-util-0.12.6-SNAPSHOT.jar!/tech/pegasys/teku/util/config/altona-genesis.ssz
                                                                                                                                                                           ^^^^^^
```

```
> ./build/install/teku/bin/teku --help
...
  -n, --network=<NETWORK>    Represents which network to use.
                               Default: altona
...
```

This causes a problem for people who install Teku, run it with no command line params to check the build and then try to attach to Medalla. The DB is configured for Altona and Teku will not start.

Resolution: Set default configuration to Medalla.
